intro: Stephania exigua, commonly known as the small stephania, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue berries that contain the toxic alkaloid tetrahydrocucurbitine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its toxic properties, it is not typically cultivated for ornamental purposes.
